Some people are super confident when it comes to creating content – and if that’s you, head straight to our pre-pic check list or Top Tips to Reduce the Risks. If you’re figuring out whether it’s for you, here’s some things creators suggest thinking about first… 

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”2″ module_class=”SOC-somethings-to-consider-left-quote ” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding_tablet=”||0px||false|false” custom_padding_phone=”||0px||false|false” custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text module_class=”glory” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_font=”|||on|||||” text_text_color=”#d9476e” text_font_size=”27px” custom_margin=”||17px||false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”||8px||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”||8px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|desktop” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Quick Cash?

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_line_height=”1.5em” link_font=”|600|||||||” link_text_color=”#00afd0″ custom_margin=”||30px|20px|false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”||11px||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”||13px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|tablet” global_colors_info=”{}”]Some people can make a lot of money for sexual content, but many don’t. Some creators say even if you make okay money at first, you may have to ‘up your game’ because of the competition, and it can take a while to get a proper income.[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”glory” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_font=”|||on|||||” text_text_color=”#d9476e” text_font_size=”27px” custom_margin=”||17px||false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”||8px||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”||8px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|desktop” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Posting is Permanent…

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_line_height=”1.5em” link_font=”|600|||||||” link_text_color=”#00afd0″ custom_margin=”||30px|20px|false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”||11px||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”||13px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|tablet” global_colors_info=”{}”]

No matter how ‘safe’ a platform seems to be, there’s always the risk that content could be leaked, screenshot, shared or sold – and friends and family members might end up seeing stuff not intended for them.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”glory” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_font=”|||on|||||” text_text_color=”#d9476e” text_font_size=”27px” custom_margin=”||17px||false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”||8px||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”25px||8px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|desktop” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Pressure?

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_line_height=”1.5em” link_font=”|600|||||||” link_text_color=”#00afd0″ custom_margin=”||20px|20px|false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”||11px||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”||-8px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_padding=”||0px||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]Online, creating content looks fun, but some creators say in reality it can be stressful. There can be pressure to post, respond to fans, and keep creating newer and edgier content. Others say you can get sucked into the demand to show more, do more, and go past boundaries you set for yourself – and then regret it.[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text module_class=”glory” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_font=”|||on|||||” text_text_color=”#d9476e” text_font_size=”27px” custom_margin=”||17px||false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”||8px||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”||8px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|desktop” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Mental Health?

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_line_height=”1.5em” link_font=”|600|||||||” link_text_color=”#00afd0″ custom_margin=”||30px|20px|false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”||11px||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”||13px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|tablet” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Some people enjoy the work, and say it has helped their body image, but others say it’s taken a toll on their mental health. Some have experienced abusive comments from users, felt pressure to do stuff they didn’t want, regretted, or have ongoing anxiety around who still has access to their pics/vids.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”glory” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_font=”|||on|||||” text_text_color=”#d9476e” text_font_size=”27px” custom_margin=”||17px||false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”||8px||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”||8px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|desktop” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Tricky Fans

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_line_height=”1.5em” link_font=”|600|||||||” link_text_color=”#00afd0″ custom_margin=”||30px|20px|false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”||11px||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”||13px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|tablet” global_colors_info=”{}”]On many platforms creators can’t just post pics and expect to rake in money. They need to interact with their users and while some might be allgood – others can get intense, ask for weird sexual stuff or even get abusive.[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”glory” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_font=”|||on|||||” text_text_color=”#d9476e” text_font_size=”27px” custom_margin=”||17px||false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”||8px||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”||8px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|desktop” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Stalkers…

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_line_height=”1.5em” link_font=”|600|||||||” link_text_color=”#00afd0″ custom_margin=”||20px|20px|false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”||11px||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”||-8px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|tablet” global_colors_info=”{}”]

While not common, there’s always the risk of some fans becoming obsessed and stalking creators. Worst case scenario is they research a creators private info (name, address, job, school etc) and share the pics with others – this is called doxing. Check out Top Tips to Reduce the Risks.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ module_class=”SOC-somethings-to-consider-right-quote” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text module_class=”glory” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_font=”|||on|||||” text_text_color=”#d9476e” text_font_size=”27px” custom_margin=”||17px||false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”||8px||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”||8px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|desktop” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Future You?

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_line_height=”1.5em” link_font=”|600|||||||” link_text_color=”#00afd0″ custom_margin=”||30px|20px|false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”||11px||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”||13px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|tablet” global_colors_info=”{}”]Some older creators wished they’d thought more about their ‘future self’ before posting. Even when they’ve closed their accounts, their pics may’ve been downloaded – so future employers, partners, friends, and even children may see what they’ve posted.[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”glory” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_font=”|||on|||||” text_text_color=”#d9476e” text_font_size=”27px” custom_margin=”||17px||false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”||8px||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”||8px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|desktop” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Sex Life?

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_line_height=”1.5em” link_font=”|600|||||||” link_text_color=”#00afd0″ custom_margin=”||20px|20px|false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”||11px||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”||13px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|tablet” global_colors_info=”{}”]Some people say creating sexual content has affected their real-life relationships and sex life. There’s lots of legal stuff to consider, so here we go…

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-pineapple-girls.gif” title_text=”SOC-pineapple-girls” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][et_pb_image src=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-legal-lowdown-quote-left-6.jpg” title_text=”SOC-legal-lowdown-quote-left-6″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”308px” module_alignment=”center” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text SOC-pink-smiley-bullet” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_line_height=”1.5em” link_text_color=”#00afd0″ custom_margin=”||-18px||false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”||-38px||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”||-38px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|desktop” custom_padding=”||0px||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]
  • At what age can you create content?
    NZ law states you can only share nude content if you’re 18 or older, and most legit platforms will require you to be 18yrs to share/post material. Sharing or selling sexual (nude) content of someone under the age of 18 is illegal in NZ as the content is considered ‘objectionable’. But that doesn’t mean you can’t access help if you are under 18.

    If you have made content and it’s been shared, it’s not your fault – help is available here: Netsafe.

  • Owning your own content
    Most online adult platforms have contracts explaining the relationship between the creator and the viewer. The uploaded content is usually owned by the creator – however, this doesn’t stop it being downloaded or screenshot.
  • Downloading and sharing content
    Many sites don’t allow downloading or sharing of pics, but some allow ‘paying members’ to download. Either way, it’s still super-easy for content to be downloaded and screenshot. If this has happened, you can contact the site for support. You can also get in touch with the NZ Police or Netsafe – it can be a slow process to get videos removed, but it is possible.
[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text SOC-pink-smiley-bullet” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_line_height=”1.5em” custom_margin=”0px||0px||false|false” custom_padding=”0px||0px||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]
  • Closing accounts/removing videos
[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin=”-6px|||36px|false|false” custom_padding=”15px||||false|false” border_width_top=”2px” border_color_top=”#00afd0″ border_style_top=”dashed” border_color_bottom=”#00afd0″ border_style_bottom=”dashed” global_colors_info=”{}”]

If you posted and own your content… most sites allow you to shut down and remove accounts. However, some pics may have already been downloaded or screenshot.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” link_text_color=”#00afd0″ custom_margin=”-5px|||36px|false|false” custom_padding=”15px||||false|false” border_width_top=”2px” border_color_top=”#00afd0″ border_style_top=”dashed” border_color_bottom=”#00afd0″ border_style_bottom=”dashed” global_colors_info=”{}”]

If someone else posted your videos without your consent… this is illegal. Contact the NZ Police or Netsafe – it can be a slow process to get videos removed, but it is possible.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” link_font=”|600|||||||” link_text_color=”#00afd0″ custom_margin=”-5px||5px|36px|false|false” custom_padding=”15px||||false|false” border_width_top=”2px” border_color_top=”#00afd0″ border_style_top=”dashed” border_color_bottom=”#00afd0″ border_style_bottom=”dashed” global_colors_info=”{}”]

If you sold or gave consent for someone to post your content, but would like it removed… this is trickier and you might need help from the pros…contact Netsafe or Youthlaw about your rights.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-legal-lowdown-quote-right-6.jpg” title_text=”SOC-legal-lowdown-quote-right-6″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_image src=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-buy-share-title-6.png” alt=”Are There Safer Ways to Sell Content Than Others” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.16″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#414143″ text_font_size=”21px” text_orientation=”center” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Some people offer cash for sexual content –
but when a creator sells their pics, it’s basically giving up ‘ownership’ of the images and there’s always some risks. So, before getting the camera out, here’s some quick things to go through…

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_2,1_2″ module_class=”SOC-buy-share-righ-image-2″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_toggle title=”Do I want to do this?” open_toggle_text_color=”#414143″ icon_color=”RGBA(217,71,110,0.53)” toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”rgba(217,71,110,0.53)” open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#414143″ title_font_size=”37px” use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_stops=”rgba(255,255,255,0.32) 0%|#ffffff 100%” background_color_gradient_overlays_image=”on” background_image=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-buy-share-bg.jpg” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’ !important;” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ box_shadow_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.18)” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Let’s be honest, we all want quick cash. But selling pics comes with risks – if you change your mind or regret posting, you may not be able to get your images back. So it’s good to take 5 to think through if you’re okay with the risks.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Get some advice” open_toggle_text_color=”#414143″ icon_color=”RGBA(217,71,110,0.53)” toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”rgba(217,71,110,0.53)” open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#414143″ title_font_size=”37px” use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_stops=”rgba(255,255,255,0.32) 0%|#ffffff 100%” background_color_gradient_overlays_image=”on” background_image=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-buy-share-bg.jpg” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’ !important;” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ box_shadow_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.18)” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Making a decision ‘in-the-moment’ can led to regrets – so take time to talk to a trusted friend about the pros/cons of the ‘offer’, safety-check it, suss out the ‘buyer’ together, and chat through whether it’s the right call.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Know your stuff” open_toggle_text_color=”#414143″ icon_color=”RGBA(217,71,110,0.53)” toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”rgba(217,71,110,0.53)” open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#414143″ title_font_size=”37px” use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_stops=”rgba(255,255,255,0.32) 0%|#ffffff 100%” background_color_gradient_overlays_image=”on” background_image=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-buy-share-bg.jpg” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’ !important;” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ box_shadow_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.18)” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Find out why, where, when and how your images are being used. There’s a big spectrum of online platforms buying content (including some dodgy ones), so make sure you’re fully okay with where your content is going.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Giving consent” open_toggle_text_color=”#414143″ icon_color=”RGBA(217,71,110,0.53)” toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”rgba(217,71,110,0.53)” open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#414143″ title_font_size=”37px” use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_stops=”rgba(255,255,255,0.32) 0%|#ffffff 100%” background_color_gradient_overlays_image=”on” background_image=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-buy-share-bg.jpg” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’ !important;” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ box_shadow_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.18)” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Consent is super important when selling pics and should be freely given (aka no pressure, bribes, threat or coercion) and informed (you know where and how the pics will be used and what your rights are).

[/et_pb_toggle][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_toggle title=”Suss the ‘buyer’ out” open_toggle_text_color=”#414143″ icon_color=”RGBA(217,71,110,0.53)” toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”rgba(217,71,110,0.53)” open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#414143″ title_font_size=”37px” use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_stops=”rgba(255,255,255,0.32) 0%|#ffffff 100%” background_color_gradient_overlays_image=”on” background_image=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-buy-share-bg.jpg” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’ !important;” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ box_shadow_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.18)” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Selling pics = giving someone else the rights to your images. Whilst some people buying content might be legit, there’s also heaps of scammers (especially online!). So, always do some research first… check out their social media pages, ask for their contact info, or talk to a model they’ve worked with.

If anything looks sketchy, they ask for money upfront, or the facts don’t add up, you might be being catfished. Checkout out Netsafe for help.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Get a contract ” open_toggle_text_color=”#414143″ icon_color=”RGBA(217,71,110,0.53)” toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”rgba(217,71,110,0.53)” open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#414143″ title_font_size=”37px” use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_stops=”rgba(255,255,255,0.32) 0%|#ffffff 100%” background_color_gradient_overlays_image=”on” background_image=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-buy-share-bg.jpg” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’ !important;” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ box_shadow_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.18)” global_colors_info=”{}”]

One of the safer ways to have some control of your content is to have a written “contract” (with a copy for you and the buyer) including what, how, and where your images will be used. This ensures the buyer can legally only use your images ‘for the agreed purposes’ in the contract (you can call the police if they don’t stick to it). If you sell pics without a contract, the buyer may do whatever they want with them.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”HELP?” open_toggle_text_color=”#414143″ icon_color=”RGBA(217,71,110,0.53)” toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”rgba(217,71,110,0.53)” open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#414143″ title_font_size=”37px” use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_stops=”rgba(255,255,255,0.32) 0%|#ffffff 100%” background_color_gradient_overlays_image=”on” background_image=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-buy-share-bg.jpg” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: ‘TrashHand’ !important;” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ box_shadow_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.18)” global_colors_info=”{}”]

If you’ve sold someone pics and they used them in a different way than you expected, remember this isn’t your fault! You might need some legal help…talk to Netsafe or YouthLaw.

[/et_pb_toggle][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”2_3,1_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”2_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” custom_padding=”21px||21px||true|false” border_width_top=”3px” border_color_top=”RGBA(217,71,110,0.53)” border_style_top=”dashed” border_width_bottom=”3px” border_color_bottom=”RGBA(217,71,110,0.53)” border_style_bottom=”dashed” global_colors_info=”{}”]

If someone online offers you cash for pics remember to check them out first… Does the hot 30 yr-old rugby player from Rangiora actually exist – or are you talking to an 80 yr-old from Lower Hutt with the same deets?”

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” link_font=”||||on||||” link_text_color=”#414143″ background_color=”#ffffff” transform_scale_tablet=”” transform_scale_phone=”” transform_scale_last_edited=”on|tablet” transform_translate_tablet=”” transform_translate_phone=”” transform_translate_last_edited=”on|tablet” transform_rotate=”0deg|0deg|5deg” transform_rotate_tablet=”0deg|0deg|2deg” transform_rotate_phone=”0deg|0deg|2deg” transform_rotate_last_edited=”on|desktop” transform_skew_tablet=”” transform_skew_phone=”” transform_skew_last_edited=”on|tablet” transform_origin_tablet=”” transform_origin_phone=”” transform_origin_last_edited=”on|tablet” transform_styles_last_edited=”on|desktop” custom_margin=”-70px||||false|false” custom_margin_tablet=”44px||||false|false” custom_margin_phone=”44px||||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|tablet” custom_padding=”25px|25px|25px|25px|true|true” transform_styles_tablet=”” transform_styles_phone=”” border_width_all=”8px” border_color_all=”rgba(255,188,71,0.24)” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ global_colors_info=”{}”]
Blackmailing or Sextortion?

If someone threatens to share sexual images of you to get something in return (money, sex, more pics etc) – this is called ‘sextortion’ or ‘blackmailing’. This is not your fault and help is available.

Check out Netsafe’s page on this for help.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” module_id=”safer-ways” module_class=”SOC-safer-ways-to-sell-content-left-pug” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin_tablet=”” custom_margin_phone=”” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_padding_tablet=”” custom_padding_phone=”||0px||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin_tablet=”” custom_margin_phone=”0px||||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_padding_tablet=”” custom_padding_phone=”0px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_image src=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-safer-ways-to-sell-content-title-2.png” alt=”Are There Safer Ways to Sell Content Than Others” title_text=”SOC-safer-ways-to-sell-content-title-2″ align=”center” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”436px” module_alignment=”center” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_font=”|700|||||||” text_text_color=”#414143″ text_font_size=”25px” text_line_height=”1.4em” text_orientation=”center” custom_margin=”||8px||false|false” text_font_size_tablet=”27px” text_font_size_phone=”18px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone” global_colors_info=”{}”]

There’s no shortage of platforms or people offering quick bucks for sexual content and most make it look like it’s a good time all round…

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_font=”||||||||” text_line_height=”1.4em” text_orientation=”center” global_colors_info=”{}”]

…but while some platforms are safer than others, the reality is none are fully risk free – so here’s a heads up on some of the risks.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”2″ module_class=”SOC-safer-ways-right-image-1″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover_enabled=”off|desktop”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][dsm_flipbox _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ min_height=”380px” global_colors_info=”{}”][dsm_flipbox_child button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ background_image=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-buy-share-bg-2.jpg” background_enable_image=”on” text_orientation=”center” min_height=”380px” custom_padding=”120px||120px||true|false” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ box_shadow_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.13)” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Subscription sites/apps

read more … [/dsm_flipbox_child][dsm_flipbox_child button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_stops=”#efefef 0%|#efefef 99%” background_color_gradient_overlays_image=”on” background_image=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-buy-share-toggle-texture.jpg” background_enable_image=”on” min_height=”380px” custom_padding=”170px|38px|170px|38px|true|true” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ box_shadow_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.13)” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Subscription sites/apps tend to host the creators accounts, and fans pay to follow them. These sites can generally be a bit safer, but creators say images can still be screenshot and shared, fans can get creepy, there’s big competition, and they need a lot of admin.

[/dsm_flipbox_child][/dsm_flipbox][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][dsm_flipbox _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ min_height=”380px” global_colors_info=”{}”][dsm_flipbox_child button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ background_image=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-buy-share-bg-2.jpg” background_enable_image=”on” background_position=”top_left” text_orientation=”center” min_height=”380px” custom_padding=”120px||120px||true|false” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ box_shadow_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.13)” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Porn sites

read more … [/dsm_flipbox_child][dsm_flipbox_child button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_stops=”#efefef 0%|#efefef 99%” background_color_gradient_overlays_image=”on” background_image=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-buy-share-toggle-texture.jpg” background_enable_image=”on” min_height=”380px” custom_padding=”170px|38px|170px|38px|true|true” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ box_shadow_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.13)” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Porn sites offer different ways to make money – custom videos, ad revenue, selling clips, modelling contests etc. Being public (and free), porn sites get heaps of traffic and have their own risks because creators don’t know who’s viewing or screenshotting their pics. Getting pics taken down can also be a super-slow process.

[/dsm_flipbox_child][/dsm_flipbox][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][dsm_flipbox _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ min_height=”380px” global_colors_info=”{}”][dsm_flipbox_child button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ background_image=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-buy-share-bg-2.jpg” background_enable_image=”on” background_position=”bottom_right” text_orientation=”center” min_height=”380px” custom_padding=”120px|15px|120px|15px|true|true” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ box_shadow_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.13)” global_colors_info=”{}”]

People via chats, DM, Messenger
or in-person

read more …

[/dsm_flipbox_child][dsm_flipbox_child button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_stops=”#efefef 0%|#efefef 99%” background_color_gradient_overlays_image=”on” background_image=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-buy-share-toggle-texture.jpg” background_enable_image=”on” min_height=”380px” custom_padding=”170px|38px|170px|38px|true|true” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ box_shadow_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.13)” global_colors_info=”{}”]

There are people that offer big bucks via chats, DM, messenger or in-person for sexual content. Quick cash can be tempting, but it’s also risky, because when creators sell their pics, they lose ownership and control. Having a contract  can help, but if someone changes their mind or regrets selling, they often can’t get their pics back. This type of work can also attract catfish or scammers.

[/dsm_flipbox_child][/dsm_flipbox][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”2″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover_enabled=”off|desktop”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_image src=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-safer-ways-to-sell-content-left-quote-6-1.jpg” title_text=”SOC-safer-ways-to-sell-content-left-quote-6″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”300px” module_alignment=”center” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][dsm_flipbox _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ min_height=”380px” global_colors_info=”{}”][dsm_flipbox_child button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ background_image=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-buy-share-bg-2.jpg” background_enable_image=”on” background_position=”bottom_left” background_horizontal_offset=”21%” text_orientation=”center” min_height=”380px” custom_padding=”120px|15px|120px|15px|true|true” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ box_shadow_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.13)” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Camming Platforms

read more … [/dsm_flipbox_child][dsm_flipbox_child button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” header_level=”h3″ use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_stops=”#efefef 0%|#efefef 99%” background_color_gradient_overlays_image=”on” background_image=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-buy-share-toggle-texture.jpg” background_enable_image=”on” min_height=”380px” custom_padding=”170px|38px|170px|38px|true|true” box_shadow_style=”preset3″ box_shadow_color=”rgba(0,0,0,0.13)” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Camming platforms host live videos where creators get fans to pay for ‘extra’ content. Some creators say camming can be really risky because it attracts dodgy folk who can record them without consent, sell their videos, make full-on sexual requests, or even send weird sexual pics. The ‘live comments’ on these sites can also be stressful.

[/dsm_flipbox_child][/dsm_flipbox][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_image src=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-safer-ways-to-sell-content-right-quote-6.jpg” title_text=”SOC-safer-ways-to-sell-content-right-quote-6″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” max_width=”290px” module_alignment=”center” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ module_id=”catfishing” Catfishing is when someone pretends to be someone they’re not…

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” link_font=”|600|||||||” link_text_color=”#00afd0″ global_colors_info=”{}”]They usually do this to trick people into sending/giving some sexual pics, money or personal details. It can be hard to spot a catfish, so before giving anyone your personal deets or pics, check out Netsafe’s Tips to Spot and Protect yourself from a catfish. It’s super easy to be scammed… and if this has happened to you, it’s not your fault and there’s no shame in it. Check out Netsafe for help. (Side note: if you’re under 18, no matter what someone says, it’s against the law in NZ to film, own or share sexual images of you).[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ prev_background_color=”#ffffff” module_id=”sugar-daddies” module_class=”SOC-sugar-daddies-right-quote” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”rgba(160,255,253,0.53)” use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_stops=”rgba(160,255,253,0.41) 0%|#ffffff 97%” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_padding=”||0px||false|false” top_divider_style=”mountains2″ global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” width_tablet=”” width_phone=”90%” width_last_edited=”on|phone” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_image src=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-SUGAR-DADDIE-6.png” title_text=”SOC-SUGAR-DADDIE-6″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”20px” text_orientation=”center” module_alignment=”center” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Getting a Sugar daddy or mama can be pretty tempting – especially with all the sugar babies on TikTok in their designer clothes and handbags stuffed with cash! While it looks like a fun time all round, it’s important to know the risks before signing up for anything – so here goes…

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text dollar-bullet” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin_tablet=”” custom_margin_phone=”||-35px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_padding_tablet=”” custom_padding_phone=”||0px||false|false” custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” global_colors_info=”{}”]
  • There’s lots of sugar daddy and mama scammers – if you get a random DM from “bestdaddy111” asking for a ‘no strings attached relationship’ in exchange for free rent, it’s probably someone sketchy.
[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text dollar-bullet” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin_tablet=”” custom_margin_phone=”||-35px||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_padding_tablet=”” custom_padding_phone=”||0px||false|false” custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” global_colors_info=”{}”]
  • There can be a power imbalance with some sugar daddies and mamas – and some might use their money/age/gifts to pressure you into doing sexual stuff you’re not comfortable with. 
  • There’s always the risk of losing control of any pics you’ve given them because they’ve paid for it.
[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text dollar-bullet” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin=”||-35px||false|false” custom_padding=”||0px||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]
  • Some sugar daddies and mamas only want the company, but most expect sexual favours.
  • Legit sugar daddies and mamas generally use verified websites and don’t randomly DM people, especially anyone under 18yrs (that’s illegal).
[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” module_id=”pre-checklist” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” and there’s no shame or judgement in it.[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_line_height=”1.5em” The main thing is understanding the risks before diving in, so there’s no regrets. 

Here’s a quick pre-pic checklist…

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-checklist-left-image-1.jpg” title_text=”SOC-checklist-left-image” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”2_3″ specialty_columns=”2″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_row_inner column_structure=”1_2,1_2″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”2″ module_class=”SOC-get-it-sorted” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin_tablet=”” custom_margin_phone=”-70px||||false|false” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_padding=”17px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column_inner type=”1_2″ saved_specialty_column_type=”2_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_toggle title=”Consent?” open_toggle_text_color=”#00afd0″ icon_color=”#00afd0″ toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”#00afd0″ open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text SOC-Checklist” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#00afd0″ title_font=”|||on|||||” title_font_size=”30px” background_color=”RGBA(255,255,255,0)” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: ‘Glory Culture’, san-serif !important;||letter-spacing: initial;||margin-left: 22px;” border_width_top=”0px” border_color_top=”#68a498″ border_width_right=”0px” border_color_bottom=”#68a498″ border_style_bottom=”dashed” border_width_left=”0px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

If someone else is buying my sexual content, have I given full, free, 100% enthusiastic consent? Do I know and understand where, when and how the content is being used?

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Risks?” open_toggle_text_color=”#00afd0″ icon_color=”#00afd0″ toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”#00afd0″ open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text SOC-Checklist” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#00afd0″ title_font=”|||on|||||” title_font_size=”30px” background_color=”RGBA(255,255,255,0)” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: ‘Glory Culture’, san-serif !important;||letter-spacing: initial;||margin-left: 22px;” border_width_top=”0px” border_color_top=”#68a498″ border_width_right=”0px” border_color_bottom=”#68a498″ border_style_bottom=”dashed” border_width_left=”0px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Am I aware there is a risk my content could be downloaded, shared, sold or screenshot? Will I be able to handle the risk of abusive, or weird messages or sexual requests from fans? Do I know there is a possibility of being stalked? Have I sussed out the buyer?

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Future Me?” open_toggle_text_color=”#00afd0″ icon_color=”#00afd0″ toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”#00afd0″ open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text SOC-Checklist” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#00afd0″ title_font=”|||on|||||” title_font_size=”30px” background_color=”RGBA(255,255,255,0)” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: ‘Glory Culture’, san-serif !important;||letter-spacing: initial;||margin-left: 22px;” border_width_top=”0px” border_color_top=”#68a498″ border_width_right=”0px” border_color_bottom=”#68a498″ border_style_bottom=”dashed” border_width_left=”0px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Am I okay with the risk of my sexual pics still being around in the future for anyone in my life to see?

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Boundaries?” open_toggle_text_color=”#00afd0″ icon_color=”#00afd0″ toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”#00afd0″ open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text SOC-Checklist” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#00afd0″ title_font=”|||on|||||” title_font_size=”30px” background_color=”RGBA(255,255,255,0)” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: ‘Glory Culture’, san-serif !important;||letter-spacing: initial;||margin-left: 22px;” border_width_top=”0px” border_color_top=”#68a498″ border_width_right=”0px” border_color_bottom=”#68a498″ border_style_bottom=”dashed” border_width_left=”0px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Have I thought through my own boundaries (what I’m comfortable doing/showing?) – and how I’ll respond to any pressure from fans to push these boundaries?

[/et_pb_toggle][/et_pb_column_inner][et_pb_column_inner type=”1_2″ saved_specialty_column_type=”2_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_css_main_element_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_main_element_phone=”margin-top: -28px;”][et_pb_toggle title=”Support?” open_toggle_text_color=”#00afd0″ icon_color=”#00afd0″ toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”#00afd0″ open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text SOC-Checklist” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#00afd0″ title_font=”|||on|||||” title_font_size=”30px” background_color=”RGBA(255,255,255,0)” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: ‘Glory Culture’, san-serif !important;||letter-spacing: initial;||margin-left: 22px;” border_width_top=”0px” border_color_top=”#68a498″ border_width_right=”0px” border_color_bottom=”#68a498″ border_style_bottom=”dashed” border_width_left=”0px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Have I talked about this with anyone? Do I have a good support network or someone to lean on if things go sideways? (Red flag…if you can’t tell anyone, you might not want to go lone wolf on this one).

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Motivation?” open_toggle_text_color=”#00afd0″ icon_color=”#00afd0″ toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”#00afd0″ open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text SOC-Checklist” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#00afd0″ title_font=”|||on|||||” title_font_size=”30px” background_color=”RGBA(255,255,255,0)” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: ‘Glory Culture’, san-serif !important;||letter-spacing: initial;||margin-left: 22px;” border_width_top=”0px” border_color_top=”#68a498″ border_width_right=”0px” border_color_bottom=”#68a498″ border_style_bottom=”dashed” border_width_left=”0px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Have I thought through why I’m creating content? It can help to talk it through with a trusted friend or professional to avoid any regrets – try Safe To Talk.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Mental Health?” open_toggle_text_color=”#00afd0″ icon_color=”#00afd0″ toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”#00afd0″ open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text SOC-Checklist” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#00afd0″ title_font=”|||on|||||” title_font_size=”30px” background_color=”RGBA(255,255,255,0)” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: ‘Glory Culture’, san-serif !important;||letter-spacing: initial;||margin-left: 22px;” border_width_top=”0px” border_color_top=”#68a498″ border_width_right=”0px” border_color_bottom=”#68a498″ border_style_bottom=”dashed” border_width_left=”0px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Have I considered any impact this could have on my mental health and real-life sexual relationships?

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”Legal stuff?” open_toggle_text_color=”#00afd0″ icon_color=”#00afd0″ toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”#00afd0″ open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text SOC-Checklist” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#00afd0″ title_font=”|||on|||||” title_font_size=”30px” background_color=”RGBA(255,255,255,0)” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: ‘Glory Culture’, san-serif !important;||letter-spacing: initial;||margin-left: 22px;” border_width_top=”0px” border_color_top=”#68a498″ border_width_right=”0px” border_color_bottom=”#68a498″ border_style_bottom=”dashed” border_width_left=”0px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Do I understand how selling content works legally and that I may no longer ‘own’ my pics once they’re online? If I’m giving someone else the rights to my pics, have I got a contract stating where and how they’re being used? And do I understand how my contract will or won’t protect me?

global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin=”34px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]There are tons of reasons why people are interested in creating sexual content…like the income, curiosity, they’ve heard it can help body confidence, or to get some sexual control after past experiences. For some, creating can be positive and others say it’s been pretty negative.
Either way, some people are more vulnerable to pressure to create content – for example, if they’re struggling with money, have had unwanted sexual experiences, are houseless, intellectually impaired or their mental health isn’t strong. Making money from content can feel like a quick fix – but posting sexual stuff is permanent and can create more problems if it’s not done safely.[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src=”https://www.intheknow.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/SOC-scribble-divider.gif” title_text=”SOC-scribble-divider” show_bottom_space=”off” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin=”|-70px|||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_font_size=”18px” text_line_height=”1.9em” custom_margin=”34px||||false|false” global_colors_info=”{}”]So, it’s good to get support before jumping into anything. If you’ve done your research and are keen to start creating, but want to keep it as safe as possible, here’s 10 quick-fire top tips…

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” custom_margin=”0px||100px||false|false” custom_padding=”0px||63px||false|false” border_color_top=”#d9476e” border_style_top=”dashed” border_color_bottom=”#d9476e” border_style_bottom=”dashed” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_toggle title=”1. Do your research on the site” open_toggle_text_color=”#414143″ icon_color=”#d9476e” toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”rgba(217,71,110,0.53)” open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#414143″ title_font=”||||||||” title_font_size=”22px” background_color=”rgba(0,175,208,0.16)” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: Poppins, san-serif !important;||letter-spacing: initial;||” border_width_top=”0px” border_color_top=”#68a498″ border_width_right=”0px” border_width_bottom=”2px” border_color_bottom=”#d9476e” border_style_bottom=”dashed” border_width_left=”0px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Secure sites generally begin with ‘https’ NOT ‘http’, have the words ‘secure’ or ‘verified’, have a privacy policy, and contact info. Try to contact the site by phone or via email – as a legit site will usually reply within a few days.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”2. Do your research on the buyer” open_toggle_text_color=”#414143″ icon_color=”#d9476e” toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”rgba(217,71,110,0.53)” open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#414143″ title_font=”||||||||” title_font_size=”22px” background_color=”rgba(0,175,208,0.16)” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: Poppins, san-serif !important;||letter-spacing: initial;||” border_width_top=”0px” border_color_top=”#68a498″ border_width_right=”0px” border_width_bottom=”2px” border_color_bottom=”#d9476e” border_style_bottom=”dashed” border_width_left=”0px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Check out their social media pages, ask for their contact info, or talk to another creator they’ve worked with. If your research shows that the buyer’s facts don’t add up, you might be being catfished – contact Netsafe.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”3. Avoid showing your face” open_toggle_text_color=”#414143″ icon_color=”#d9476e” toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”rgba(217,71,110,0.53)” open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#414143″ title_font=”||||||||” title_font_size=”22px” background_color=”rgba(0,175,208,0.16)” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: Poppins, san-serif !important;||letter-spacing: initial;||” border_width_top=”0px” border_color_top=”#68a498″ border_width_right=”0px” border_width_bottom=”2px” border_color_bottom=”#d9476e” border_style_bottom=”dashed” border_width_left=”0px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Fans can put your photo into google image search (which can link them back to your personal accounts), so keep your face, tattoos and personal items hidden in shots. If you want to show your face, change other parts of your image e.g. use a wig or sunglasses.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”4. Keep your private deets private” open_toggle_text_color=”#414143″ icon_color=”#d9476e” toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”rgba(217,71,110,0.53)” open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#414143″ title_font=”||||||||” title_font_size=”22px” background_color=”rgba(0,175,208,0.16)” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: Poppins, san-serif !important;||letter-spacing: initial;||” border_width_top=”0px” border_color_top=”#68a498″ border_width_right=”0px” border_width_bottom=”2px” border_color_bottom=”#d9476e” border_style_bottom=”dashed” border_width_left=”0px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Keep your real name, address and info about your family/friends private. Use a separate email and password to create accounts.

[/et_pb_toggle][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_css_main_element_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_main_element_phone=”margin-top: -40px;”][et_pb_toggle title=”5. Set your boundaries” open_toggle_text_color=”#414143″ icon_color=”#d9476e” toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”rgba(217,71,110,0.53)” open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#414143″ title_font=”||||||||” title_font_size=”22px” background_color=”rgba(0,175,208,0.16)” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: Poppins, san-serif !important;||letter-spacing: initial;||” border_width_top=”0px” border_color_top=”#68a498″ border_width_right=”0px” border_width_bottom=”2px” border_color_bottom=”#d9476e” border_style_bottom=”dashed” border_width_left=”0px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Write a list of absolute ‘no’ content you don’t want to create – and aim to stick to these boundaries.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”6. Report or block dodgy users ” open_toggle_text_color=”#414143″ icon_color=”#d9476e” toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”rgba(217,71,110,0.53)” open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#414143″ title_font=”||||||||” title_font_size=”22px” background_color=”rgba(0,175,208,0.16)” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: Poppins, san-serif !important;||letter-spacing: initial;||” border_width_top=”0px” border_color_top=”#68a498″ border_width_right=”0px” border_width_bottom=”2px” border_color_bottom=”#d9476e” border_style_bottom=”dashed” border_width_left=”0px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Report anyone who is being abusive, manipulative or regularly asks you to go past your personal boundaries (contact Netsafe or the NZ Police).

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”7. Turn off your ‘location information’” open_toggle_text_color=”#414143″ icon_color=”#d9476e” toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”rgba(217,71,110,0.53)” open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#414143″ title_font=”||||||||” title_font_size=”22px” background_color=”rgba(0,175,208,0.16)” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: Poppins, san-serif !important;||letter-spacing: initial;||” border_width_top=”0px” border_color_top=”#68a498″ border_width_right=”0px” border_width_bottom=”2px” border_color_bottom=”#d9476e” border_style_bottom=”dashed” border_width_left=”0px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Turn off any location info (on your pics, in Snapchat maps and even in your phone settings) – and if you’re using OnlyFans you can use ‘geoblock’ (top right). This limits people in certain regions from seeing your content.

[/et_pb_toggle][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_css_main_element_last_edited=”on|phone” custom_css_main_element_phone=”margin-top: -40px;”][et_pb_toggle title=”8. Get a contract” open_toggle_text_color=”#414143″ icon_color=”#d9476e” toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”rgba(217,71,110,0.53)” open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#414143″ title_font=”||||||||” title_font_size=”22px” background_color=”rgba(0,175,208,0.16)” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: Poppins, san-serif !important;||letter-spacing: initial;||” border_width_top=”0px” border_color_top=”#68a498″ border_width_right=”0px” border_width_bottom=”2px” border_color_bottom=”#d9476e” border_style_bottom=”dashed” border_width_left=”0px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Get as much formal detail (who, where, how) as possible in a contract, get a friend to check it before you sign, and ALWAYS keep a copy. Note: all reputable sites will ask for age verification – and if they don’t, that’s a red flag.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”9. Get Support” open_toggle_text_color=”#414143″ icon_color=”#d9476e” toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”rgba(217,71,110,0.53)” open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#414143″ title_font=”||||||||” title_font_size=”22px” background_color=”rgba(0,175,208,0.16)” custom_margin=”||0px||false|false” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: Poppins, san-serif !important;||letter-spacing: initial;||” border_width_top=”0px” border_color_top=”#68a498″ border_width_right=”0px” border_width_bottom=”2px” border_color_bottom=”#d9476e” border_style_bottom=”dashed” border_width_left=”0px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Make sure you’ve got some great support including trusted friends and other creators who can support you if anything gets tricky.

[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle title=”10. Read the site Terms & Conditions.” open_toggle_text_color=”#414143″ icon_color=”#d9476e” toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ use_icon_font_size=”on” icon_font_size=”20px” open_icon_color=”rgba(217,71,110,0.53)” open_toggle_icon=”||divi||400″ open_use_icon_font_size=”on” open_icon_font_size=”20px” module_class=”rf-body-text” _builder_version=”4.17.4″ _module_preset=”default” title_text_color=”#414143″ title_font=”||||||||” title_font_size=”22px” background_color=”rgba(0,175,208,0.16)” custom_margin=”||50px||false|false” custom_css_toggle_title=”font-family: Poppins, san-serif !important;||letter-spacing: initial;||” border_width_top=”0px” border_color_top=”#68a498″ border_width_right=”0px” border_width_bottom=”2px” border_color_bottom=”#d9476e” border_style_bottom=”dashed” border_width_left=”0px” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Some sites have better Terms and Conditions (found at bottom of site) and better ‘model support’ than others – so do your research before you sign up and go with the safer-looking sites.
